comments.body: Like the Bobivote Pale pumpkin.
Maybe have tree roots coming down to the floor, an arrow trap for chests and tripwires and secret doors (like the jungle temple) and there be a higher chance of ores?

It's kinda stupid that they didn't add fireflies because they would poison frogs, like, you're in charge of the game! If you don't want to poison the frogs then just make frogs not eat them! And why do we have a problem with poisoning frogs but not with poisoning bees using the new flower?
It would be cool to have them in the pale garden if they have the same texture as the creakings eyes.

Yeah, they should definitely look like creaking eyes. This would be SO cool, like, I wish I could vote more than once! Really hope they add this. It would make the biome so much creepier if they looked like eyes... you'd never know if the orange glow following you was a harmless firefly or a terrible monster closing in for the kill!
when they told me they were adding the fireflies I got so exited but then they got me the surprise that ''we aren´t adding the fireflies because they are poisonous for frogs'' I got so disaponted
I agree
Yeah, why not fix the frog-eating-firefly issue and just add back a rather missed mob?

Something that I think would be much more interesting then just normally buffing the creaking damage, would be instead buffing the speed. I've seen many people requesting the creaking was faster, and this would be a cool way to do it. It would also mean that there would be diversity between the creaking encounters since some would be faster and some would be slower due to the rng of the tree generation.

In addition, buffing the damage of the creaking would be harder to do because there is no way to communicate to the player that one creaking is more dangerous than another one until after it hits the player. However buffing the speed would be more visually obvious and more interesting mechanically
This would be a great way to customize the Creaking!
netherite horse armor would be cool
Yeah, really cool!
WE MUST HAVE NETHERITE HORSE ARMOR!!!!!
I would really love Netherite Horse Armor because it would be an advantage for horse protection and it would match our Netherite gear, don't you agree???
lets demand netherite horse armor once more, horse should have not worse armor choices than nautilus
with the newest snapshots, we are wanting this good sink for horse armor, and it only makes sense
This is finally going to get added in Mounts of Mayhem!
That's so fun
Great easter egg for the game.

This is kinda vague... when creating a world on Halloween, are the only seeds you can be generated are ones where you spawn in a pale forest? What if you join an existing world? Does the entire spawn area become a pale forest? What if you manually type in a seed?
This is a great idea!
This is a very good idea, Minecraft should really add this!
This would be so cool, imagine if you looked into the fog and saw the creaking's glowing orange eyes glaring back at you!
Yes, but all the time, not just at night.
I love it! But it should only be darker at night, and there still be a light fog at day

I would love to see this but perhaps only when you are in a radius of the Creeking Heart because if it was to be a permanent thing then it could potentially ruin the feel you want to create in the biome
Even adding a new type of dirt exclusive to this biome with a desaturated colour pallet would be an excellent change!

Or instead of the moss, use a dirt variant:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/30666990341773-Pale-Dirt
Depending on the seed and world pos, you can get some extremely large biomes.
Add a new flowers and a root of the pale garden...
this is brilliant! though instead of making it so you get the effect when you're in the biome, make it so you get it when you're near a creaking or a creaking heart.

Instead of it being connected to the biome itself, the effect should be give when it proximity of an active creaking heart or an on hit effect given by the creaking.
The pale garden has such unique grass and foliage colors and it would be such a shame if no one would set up a base there just because of the annoyance of this effect.
Maybe the hanging moss would be the potion ingredient / the cause of the entanglement effect. It'd be nice to give it a use beyond decoration.

I believe the effect should apply if the mob/player is in a 34 block proximity to the creaking heart.

This would make the effect only work when near a creaking and its heart, but also making it possible to elimanate the entanglement effect.

yes, it happens around creaking hearts only. also the creakign could drop pale bark to brew a potion of entaglemant that would be useless unless you make splash or lingering potions to use on your enemies in pvp, or on arrows.

I think this makes more sense too. I like the grass color, instead maybe when pale moss is next to it the grass is a shaded to the color it is now? This could make sense anyways like the grass and moss have a biological relationship, or they effect each others photosynthetic pigments.
For me dirt is really too much saturated, it should be way more pale.
I agree, the current grass color isn't great. If making the grass color pale is too much grey at least make it a cool looking color like purple.
Certainly generation akin to the lush caves could be 'nice' with moss all over, and then some sort of shrubs could be used to house the hearts.

The night and day mechanic would enhance the experience of an underground Pale Garden biome, adding an element of uncertainty when exploring pale garden caves. The mechanic would add ambiguity about whether the creakings are spawning or not, and when they do it would feel almost random due to the lack of sunlight.
This would help with the problem of small pale gardens.
Imagine if the trees on the surface biome were a bit larger and the cavern biome was filled with giant, twisting roots.
Making it a cave biome would also encourage players to enter it even if only to get to another part of the cave or mine the iron they spotted.
It could be used to make medicine, which cures you of all negative status effects.
maybe cure of specifically blindness. similar to how honey cures only poison. the resin has a connection to eyes
They NEED to make more uses for resin.
Realmente seriam ótimos
awesome

I think it would make sense for structes that generate within the pale garden (if they're added) to contain variants of the creaking hearts that produce much stronger creakings.

Perhaps a cluser of 2x2 creaking hearts could summon a creaking boss even

I think a good way to buff it would be to give it a "piercing" effect, meaning that it does the same amount of damage no matter what armor the player is wearing. So, it would still only do 1-3 damage but getting surrounded by them would make them much more deadly, no matter what level of the game you are at.
yes, armor piecring and 4-5 hearts so that it will one or two shot you. this makes it terrifiying.
Yeah they should be able to kill you easily, so players are actually scared.
Player looked away?
HA! That's funny! :D
SCP-173 XD
Something like that would be cool, since the creaking has such unique behaviour
The new player would ragequit lol
XD
10/10 if this is a doctor who reference, otherwise, 10/10 still much more interesting and unique.

I think you misunderstand how hard it is too add a mob to Minecraft, when they show a mob off for a mob vote its nothing but an idea on paper, no coding has been finished or anything. So it's not like these mobs are just sitting around waiting to be implemented. Adding all of them would be like 11 mobs! Far more than Mojang could handle in one update! Each update only comes out with 1-2 mobs, and that was before they decided to do smaller (but more frequent) updates like they are now!

But don't lose hope for all of them, I'm pretty sure the biomes will all be added eventually, and I heard somewhere that the penguin and crab were not gone forever.
Not all at one update; I think a few should be added sometimes for the next updates. Like, Vulture and Ostrich to be added in a Bird Drop or something. But I like your idea
ONLY THE PENGUIN ONLY THE PENGUIN
penguins are boring
Rascal
great idea
I love this... maybe using this flower on the sniffer egg causes it to freeze as an egg too to be used as a decorative block!
Not a fan of the name, But this would be very nice for baby squids
How exactly do you benefit from a baby animal that can't age?
adorei!!! mas acho que clockflower nao é um nome muito bom

to the guy that said ''how do you benefit from a baby animal that can't age'':

Same way you benefit from a grass block, iron block, quartz block, stone brick, 

It would be nice to keep as pet, and baby squids for example would be an amazing pet to keep, though it would be a bit weird for a squid specifically to eat a flower,
WE DID IT!
Also add some piglins from Minecraft Legends.

And you can tame normal ghasts? That would be a nice idea. Then you could have a nice little ghast army, and maybe have them like have smiles on them if tamed like wolves eyes become different when you tame them?
I feel like we add another structure to the nether, but maybe one that IS NOT a fortress
Guys ! They did add baby ghast !!!!!
Oh hovering inferno, while many may not remember you, we know and wish for you.

I think at least creepers shouldn't spawn. Or maybe just have zombies spawn. I think the devs said that they intentionally kept hostile mob spawning to add more challenge, but I can't find where they said it
They should just make the creaking more challenging and then remove the other mobs (but keep bats). This way the biome has a more consistent theme but is also still scary.
Yeah, I agree, other mobs ruin the ambience of the Pale Garden. At least get rid of Creepers, or make the Creaking attack the other hostile mobs.
I agree. It should be rarer but also bigger.

I went to a pale garden, the only one within a thousand blocks and it had only three creaking hearts. The size of this biome is definitely a issue and will discourage players from making full use of the update.
I found a seed with a 900 blocks Pale Garden. It's simply an amazing gameplay, we need that seed to become a common generation

Good idea. I'd also like it as a potion ingredient, and maybe add a feature like dripstone where it can fill up a cauldron. So many items could benefit from additional uses. The single-use items are beginning to accumulate

Some other suggestions:

  • It lets you see into the Nether from the Overworld side, and vice versa.
  • It only lets its creator through (useful for PvP and stopping mobs from coming through to the Overworld).
  • It creates a treasure chest on the other side of the portal, full of things to help you survive the Nether.
Maybe instead of it being a nether portal, it could be a portal to an ocean monument since people typically relate crying to water.
i vote yes i like the idea of mushroom chickens.

The cows are perfect! They are noble, intelligent, not to mention delicious- oh, sorry. Ahem, I meant... graceful. ah, yes, that's *cough, cough* definitely what I meant.

(*Creeping up to a mooshroom cow with a fork and steak knife in hand*)

MOOOO!!!
sheepshroom
baashroom
Shroomlin-walking mushroom that trades rare mushrooms
mabye the cluck shroom?
These pale lush caves should definitely also be haunted by the creaking. Perhaps a mossy variant so it blends in better
The Pale Lush Caves should be able to spawn Pale Oak Trees in the larger caverns as well, and they are more likely to have Creaking Hearts in them, to make the caves more dangerous at night.
Veins of resin in the walls/floor/ceilings of Pale Lush Caves? It is also possible for them to spawn as pillars in large caverns.
This is an awesome idea, maybe there could be some special variant of creaking found in the ruins that is harder to defeat and could drop something special.
